Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 08:08AM kingcour wrote: Thank you for sharing! I was diagnosed April 25, 2012, stage IV from the beginning! I am 37 with four children. I started TCH on May 7, but just started the new Pertuzumab in place of the Carbo this week. I had mets to bone and liver. However, this week my CA 27-29 was down to 18! I am in the gym working with a trainer, eating healthier than ever, and most importantly, praying like crazy! My youngest is almost 6 months. I am determined to raise him AND to rock his babies! Keep the positives coming!

Posts.Title: Brain MRI - Negative :-) JeninMichigan Leah_S

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2013 07:14PM kingcour wrote: Don't let cancer steal your joy! I have four kids, and my youngest will be 1 on Valentine's Day. I was too young for a mammogram, and I found the lump while breast feeding. I was diagnosed Stage IV out of the gate, with extensive mets to bones and liver. One of my liver lesions was 7 cm...twice as big ad my breast tumor! I started chemo May 7. After I was first diagnosed, all I could think about was not being there for my kids. I will go for my last chemo treatment on March 21 because I am now all clear! I will continue on Herceptin and Pertuzumab (targeted therapies), but will be blessed to have a chemo break after 10 months. There are many treatments out there for you. Pray for your body to respond properly to the chemo, keep your head held high, an tell yourself that you will be with your baby for a LONG time. That's what I do, plus I go to the gym at least 3 times a week and try to get in all of my fruits and veggies. Every little bit helps! Praying for you!
